snippet: Chrysler and Ford were among several auto companies that reported healthy increases for January, but General Motors posted a 6 percent decrease from a year ago.
abstract: Autodata reports new-vehicle sales in the United States increased 11.4 percent in January 2012 from January 2011, to 913,287; annual selling rate rose to 14.18 million, the highest in more than two years; Chrysler and Ford reported healthy increases for January, but General Motors had 6 percent decrease.
lead_paragraph: Chrysler and Ford were among several auto companies that reported healthy increases for January, but General Motors posted a 6 percent decrease from a year ago.

headline.main: In a Surprise, Car Sales Start New Year Strongly
headline.print_headline: In a Surprise, Car Sales Start New Year Strongly
